intro: Primula triflora, commonly known as the three-flowered primrose, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of about 15–30 centimeters, with hairy stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually pink or white, and they often appear in clusters of three, giving the plant its common name. Primula triflora prefers cool, moist environments and is often found in forested areas or rocky soils.
